post.body: What system are you susing to follow people back automatically? Btw, I have been enjoying your tweets!
Best of luck, and congrats!
I have no idea how to accept it, but I'd love to hear how you do. I'll check out the site and see if I can figure it out. GL!
Hey Adam! protected update is an update which is not viewable to the general public (as indicated by a little gray lock).
Thanks friend for the advice. There seems to be a general consensus on the monetizing topic: it's just not worth it.
The Simple Press Forum looks great, and it's exactly what I have been wanting for my site. Thanks for the share!
Thanks Brian for your advice, I appreciate the shared wisdom.
Your right, it is not worth it. I'll put more thought into the subject. Thanks for your reply, I appreciate it.
You can't say much to sway irrational people...
Take THAT world hunger!
Best of luck with the good fight!
Ok time for breakfast, for real this time.
Time for breakfast...take THAT early risers!
When people have protected updates, I find myself with this strange urge to send them a follow request.
Thanks for your @ replies, I'll do a little more reading on the subject. The friends I have made on twitter are worth more than the money...
I'm considering monetizing my twitter account with 'Twittad'. The extra funds would be nice; what do you think? https://www.twittad.com/a/mD
Passing on the word: If you got a Twitter Phishing DM email Send the user a DM, and tell them to change their password.
Thought I'd share this read http://tinyurl.com/8cq68k
This twitter phishing scam is everywhere, I have received over 15 of those pesky DMs... How would someone profit off of something like that?
I could really go for a Churro right about now...
